page.title: 18"FOX AND HOUNDS",RISELEY
page.content: Everything in the Fox and Hounds kitchen is much larger than in the usual houses. The pots and pans are massive to withstand the immense heat of the cookers. Instead of having cupboards to keep the pots and pans in, the kitchen has wire racks so that the chefs can find their equipment more easily. The cookers can get up to l000deg.F. Mr. Cheeseman uses fresh food to cook with. Soon a new restaurant is going to be built and more food, like Sunday lunches,will be served. There is also a glass washer and a dishwasher in the kitchen. The glasswasher holds 20 glasses at once and the dishwasher holds l00 pieces of crockery at once.
